CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 24, 1941, pg. 20, reads: "They'll Be Honored By Elks - Pictured above are the Chesterfield Girls of Pittsburgh, who comprise one of the most progressive clubs in city. They will be honored Decoration Day Eve,  Thursday, May 29, at the Iron City Elks' gigantic cabaret dance and floor show.  The big affair will be held at the Elks Lodge No. 17, at 81 Fullerton street.  There will be dancing from 12 midnight to 6 a. m. THe committee in charge is composed of Exalted Ruler Walter Rainey; Master of Social Session Committee, Billy H. Alston; Chairman, Edward English; Grant Bolden, Lemuel Nixon, Raymond Johnson, Edgar Parker and George (Buss) Christian.  Music will be furnished by Neeny Waters and his orchestra."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of members of Chesterfield Girls, from left: Charlene Coles, Jeanette Paige, Arnetta S. Green wearing monkey fur, Kathleen Holloway, Ann Mays, and Mary Palmer, posed around war monument in park
